medical_history.chief_complaint: Progressive loss of fat involving the upper half of her body.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began at age 6 with noted progressive thinning of the face and loss of fat on the neck, shoulders, and upper trunk. The initial symptom of fat loss was first observed at that time, and by 1979 all fat in the upper half of her body had disappeared. At age 28, she presented with an alopecic plaque on her scalp that had appeared 4 months earlier.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient had a history of 2 previous spontaneous miscarriages. In 2000, she was diagnosed with antiphospholipid syndrome based on positive anticardiolipin antibodies and other immunologic evaluations. During her pregnancy in 2001, she developed gestational diabetes.
medical_history.family_history: Family medical history includes a sister with lichen sclerosus and atrophicus.
